Seneca.translation[0].definitions[0].def: (about 4 BC-65 AD) a Roman philosopher, politician, and writer of plays. He was the teacher of Nero, the emperor,  and had a lot of influence over him. But later, Nero believed Seneca was involved in a plan to kill him, and ordered him to kill himself.
Seneca.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a Native American tribe who live on reservations (=areas of land that are kept separate for Native Americans to live on)  in western New York State and eastern Ohio
Seneca.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a member of the Seneca tribe
Seneca.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a Native American language spoken by the Seneca tribe
